meanings.definition: The quality or state of being adamant.
meanings.sent1: Her adamancy in sticking to her beliefs impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: His adamancy in refusing to change his mind caused some tension.
meanings.sent3: Despite his adamancy, she managed to convince him to try something new.
meanings.sent4: The adamancy of the old tree roots breaking through the concrete symbolized strength.
meanings.sent5: The adamancy of the toddler in wanting the blue toy truck was unmatched.

meanings.definition: The act of being unyielding or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The adamancy of the stubborn mule made it difficult to move.
meanings.sent2: Her adamancy in following the rules sometimes caused frustration.
meanings.sent3: The adamancy of the cat in refusing to eat anything but tuna was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The adamancy of the storm in knocking down trees was frightening.
meanings.sent5: The adamancy of the lock on the old chest kept its contents safe.
